title: Title and extent of operation of the Code
text: This Act shall be called the Pakistan Penal Code, and shall extend to the whole of Pakistan.
illustration: An offence committed in any province or territory of Pakistan is governed by the Pakistan Penal Code.
Courts in Pakistan apply the Pakistan Penal Code uniformly throughout the country.

commentary.Overview: Section 1 introduces the name and territorial extent of the Pakistan Penal Code. It establishes the legal identity of the Code and clarifies where it applies.

Title of the Code.Explanation: The statute is officially named the Pakistan Penal Code. All criminal liability and offences defined under it are referred to by this title.
Title of the Code.Importance: The title is used in judgments, charge sheets, FIRs, and legal drafting.

Extent of Operation.Explanation: The Code extends to the whole of Pakistan, meaning it applies uniformly across all provinces, territories, and areas under Pakistanâ€™s jurisdiction.
Extent of Operation.Legal Effect: Any offence committed within Pakistan is subject to the provisions of this Code unless specifically excluded by law.

Relation with Other Sections.Section 2: Explains punishment of offences committed within Pakistan.
Relation with Other Sections.Section 3 and 4: Deal with offences committed beyond Pakistan but triable under Pakistani law.

Practical Significance.Courts: All criminal courts in Pakistan derive substantive criminal law from the PPC.
Practical Significance.Law Enforcement: Police register cases under PPC sections because of its nationwide applicability.

commentary.Exam Note: Section 1 is introductory but often cited to explain the territorial application of criminal law in Pakistan.
